description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Milo Beckman made his debut in June with a sensational Friday grid (Across Lite, Solution, blog), and hes back today. Fortunately, hes going easy on us this time with a Monday grid that I enjoyed.

title: A Ninja Warrior Upgrade Into Network Prime Time
description: The American embrace of full-contact Japanese game shows  from reconditioned originals like the former MXC on Spike to clones like Wipeout on ABC  has to do with the appeal of bright colors, spectacular crashes and other peoples embarrassment and discomfort. And, of course, the pleasure of rooting for a winner: after all the carnage, someone is crowned champion.

title: Annie Hall Meets Manhattan in Los Angeles
description: When AMC started a division to develop original Web series, it was reasonable to expect that the online shows would resemble the channels ballyhooed television dramas  Breaking Bad, Mad Men, The Walking Dead, The Killing  that traffic in pitch-black humor and grim horror and film noir. But the only thing darker than usual about The Trivial Pursuits of Arthur Banks, the first AMC Digital Studios production, is the black and white cinematography. The three-episode, 42-minute project, which goes live on Monday at amctv.com and Hulu, is a loving send-up of Woody Allen in his European art-house phase, complete with limited color palette, melancholy jazz score and Adam Goldberg standing in for Mr. Allen as the sex-and-maybe-love-obsessed male artist.

title: It Takes a Headless Lady to Cause New Yorkers to Stop
description: An Upper West Sider is walking past Citarella when her head falls off. Two elegant couples celebrate New Years Eve at the Waldorf-Astoria with increasing venom. A gay man visits his dementia-isolated mother in Queens.

title: Cantonese Erotic Fantasy: 3-D and One Lousy Lover
description: The Cantonese historical fantasy 3D Sex and Zen: Extreme Ecstasy was banned in mainland China but is now rolling out in cities across the United States and Canada. The Chinese government has committed either an astute piece of film criticism, an insidious act of cultural terrorism or both.

title: Dark but Danceable Visions of a Chilly Technological Future
description: Handsome Furs were every bit the manic electro party band when they performed at Bowery Ballroom on Thursday night. Dan Boeckner and Alexei Perry, a married couple from Montreal, each had a bank of keyboards and synthesizers synced to pumping drum-machine beats. The nasal, staccato riffs and responses harked back to 1980s synth-pop and its starker sibling, Krautrock: half-mechanized, insistent and catchy.

title: Nova Extends a Streak on a Day of Good News
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Other than a botched play in the outfield that did not prove costly, there was much for the Yankees to admire and savor about Sundays 3-0 victory against the Minnesota Twins.

title: Web Site Ranks Hacks and Bestows Bragging Rights
description: So you think you can hack?

title: Sutra Dance Theater
description: Photos of a performance at One New York Plaza.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Mexican President Stars in New Tourism Pitch
description: President Felipe Caldern of Mexico has a new role in efforts to lift Mexicos sagging tourism industry, according to The Associated Press. Mr. Caldern, 49, will appear as an adventure guide of sorts in 30-minute television programs to appear starting next month on public television stations in the United States. He wears an Indiana Jones-style hat and a harness and descends a rope into a cavern, accompanied by Peter Greenberg, host of the The Royal Tour series. The A.P. reports that Mr. Caldern also straps on scuba tanks to lead Mr. Greenberg into a sinkhole lake, known as a cenote, in the Yucatn and helps a Lacandon Indian paddle a boat down a jungle river. Mr. Calderns message is that Mexico is safe for tourists. Foreign tourism in 2010, not including border-area visitors, was down 6.3 percent from 2008 levels, and the first half of 2011 saw a 2 percent decline from the same period in 2010, according to the countrys central bank. The global economy and Mexicos drug violence have been blamed, though foreign tourists have not been targets of the violence.

title: Four Deutsche Bank Employees Are Charged in South Korea
description: Four Deutsche Bank employees and its South Korean brokerage house face a trial at a South Korean court after they were charged by prosecutors with causing a one-day rout in stocks in November that wiped out $27 billion in value, the company confirmed on Saturday.

title: Skype Buys GroupMe, a Mobile Messaging Start-Up
description: Skype, the Internet calling service, said on Sunday that it was buying GroupMe, a year-old start-up in New York that offers a group-messaging service for cellphones.

title: Comics PAC Is More Than a Gag
description: Lets start with a spot political quiz. Which of the following are legitimate political action committees known as Super PACs, and which is fake?

title: Carl Hanford, Kelsos Trainer, Dies at 95
description: In the spring of 1960, as the nations leading 3-year-old thoroughbreds vied in the Triple Crown, Carl Hanford began training horses for Allaire du Pont at her Bohemia Stable in Maryland. One of his first projects was a 3-year-old who had been gelded by his previous trainer to help him gain weight and to calm an ornery disposition. His name was Kelso.

title: Spend Now, Save Later, Bond Fund Leaders Say
description: WASHINGTON  Early in Bill Clintons presidency, his populist advisers saw their spending plans crash into resistance from Wall Street, which demanded deficit-cutting austerity.

title: On Wall St., a Big Split on Outlook
description: Amid all the grim economic data and a chorus of warnings of a fresh recession, one group on Wall Street has remained remarkably optimistic despite the dangers that may lie ahead  the research analysts who track individual companies.

title: F.B.I.s Man on the Pirate Beat, Seeking Confessions
description: In the F.B.I.s expansive offices in Lower Manhattan, a black-and-white banner on Special Agent Kevin P. Coughlins desk stands out amid the rows of cubicles. It is a Jolly Roger, skull above crossed swords, the pirates calling card.

title: Tribal Clashes Raise Fears of Instability in South Sudan
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Tribal clashes in a region of newly independent South Sudan have killed at least 58 people in the past week, the United Nations says, raising fears of ethnic instability in the deeply impoverished country.

title: Summer Diversions to Fill the Mad Men Void
description: FOR the last four summers, Madison Avenue has been absorbed in Mad Men, the AMC series about the advertising industry in the 1960s. But a delay in production for the coming season means there are no new episodes until early next year.

title: Five Steps to Solving Europes Debt Crisis
description: The crisis of 2008 is repeating itself in reverse. Three years ago, European governments stepped in to save the banking sector. Today, the euro zones indebted sovereigns are threatening to cause a full-scale bank panic and possibly even another credit crisis. Europes lenders must be insulated from their governments and vice versa. Five radical steps could break the bank-sovereign doom loop.

title: To Enjoy Fall Scenery, Prepare for Uneven Lies
description: For a lot of golfers, the late summer and approaching fall is the best time to play. Its less crowded and the air is crisper. A personal choice of mine is to head for the hills, where the foliage and scenery enhance every round. But if you play where there are elevation changes, you will find yourself with a lot of sidehill and downhill lies off the tee.

title: N.Y. Still Pursues Case Against Whistle-Blower
description: ALBANY  The Cuomo administration is continuing to pursue a two-year-old disciplinary case against Jeffrey Monsour, a state employee at the Office for People With Developmental Disabilities who has been an outspoken critic of the agencys management.

title: Career-Worst Day For Indians Jimenez, the Ace Who Isnt
description: DETROIT  There is no cheering in the press box, as the rule goes, but as far as I know, were allowed an occasional exclamation. At the end of the Tigers/Indians series on Sunday at Comerica Park, I let out a Wow! Couldnt help it. Not often do you see a game end on a double play from center field to the plate.

title: A Champions Putter Worth Its Weights
description: Most of the putter talk after Keegan Bradleys Aug. 14 victory in the P.G.A. Championship was about how he became the first player to use a belly putter to win a mens major. Bradley used an Odyssey White Hot XG Sabertooth that was nearly 47 inches long. Im a golf traditionalist, but Im also tired of the debate. Long putters will never be banned at this point and they no doubt help some people keep playing golf. Lets get used to them.

title: How to Take Lessons in the Winter (or in Secret)
description: The overwhelming majority of recreational golfers do not take lessons. It is another one of those quizzical, only-in-golf mysteries. Most of us could use help and the help is widely available, so, naturally, most golfers instead keep their heads down (or not) and plod on, hoping to master the game on their own.

title: Attorney General of N.Y. Is Said to Face Pressure on Bank Foreclosure Deal
description: Eric T. Schneiderman, the attorney general of New York, has come under increasing pressure from the Obama administration to drop his opposition to a wide-ranging state settlement with banks over dubious foreclosure practices, according to people briefed on discussions about the deal.

title: The Kids Are Not All Right
description: Vancouver, British Columbia

title: The Hidden Costs of Higher Ed
description: OVER the next few weeks, millions of Americans will be heading off to college, and despite the promise of need-blind admissions, more of them than ever will be struggling to pay for it. Its not just the economys fault: even as they publicize lavish financial aid packages, colleges and universities are making it harder for average American families to afford higher education, while making it easier for the wealthy.

title: How Italy Is Adjusting
description: Turin, Italy

title: Are There Any Big Ideas Anymore?
description: To the Editor:

title: Thousands Back Antigraft Hunger Strike in New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI  Sunil and Suman Wadhwa dressed their 4-year-old son in a crisp white shirt and checkered shorts on Sunday for the blisteringly hot trip into New Delhi. They had never participated in a political rally, but after watching the anticorruption campaigner Anna Hazare on television, they wanted to do more than watch.

title: Grieving After 9/11
description: To the Editor:

title: Equality for Transgenders
description: To the Editor:

title: Regulate Online Gambling
description: To the Editor:

title: Motorolas Identity Crisis
description: Hundreds of framed patents hang on two separate walls at the headquarters of Motorola Mobility in Libertyville, Ill. They testify to the pride in innovation at Motorola, a luminary of American business that has survived corporate crises and enormous technological change.

title: Biggest Brewer Could Be Going, Going, Gone
description: The son of a former big leaguer, Prince Fielder has a keen appreciation for baseballs history. For instance, to Fielder one perk of playing in Milwaukee is that Robin Yount, who spent his entire Hall of Fame career with the Brewers, sometimes stops by to visit the team.

title: Trade Commission Challenges a Hospital Merger
description: WASHINGTON  Obama administration officials have been roaming the country, talking up their vision of a future in which doctors and hospitals team up to provide better care at lower cost. But a starkly different picture is unfolding this summer in a courtroom here, where lawyers from the Federal Trade Commission have been challenging a hospital merger in Toledo, Ohio.

title: Would-Be Billionaires, Lost in Song
description: DEAR DIARY:

title: Train Line Far From Arrival Has a Color to Be Noticed
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority may be criticized for its weekend service suspensions, broken escalators and packed L trains.

title: Local TV Newscasts Expanding
description: ST. LOUIS  Coming soon to this citys television screens: more news at 4 in the morning, again at 10, and at 4 in the afternoon.

title: Federal Push for Cloud Technology Faces Skepticism
description: WASHINGTON  Before cost-cutting became fashionable in Washington, Vivek Kundra, the White Houses chief information officer, was working to shrink the federal governments enormous budget for information technology.

title: In California, a Second Episode of Fan Violence
description: For the second time in less than five months, officials in California are investigating a violent event involving sports fans, after two people were shot Saturday in the parking lot of Candlestick Park in San Francisco following a professional football game.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: ConvaTec Said to Bid for Kinetic Concepts
description: ConvaTec, a company owned by two private equity firms, has made a bid for Kinetic Concepts that is higher than the wound-healing technology companys $4.9 billion deal with another group of investors, a person briefed on the matter told DealBook on Sunday.

title: Messing With Texas
description: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas hasnt lost an election in 10 tries. Among his vanquished opponents, this streak has inspired not only the usual mix of resentment and respect, but a touch of supernatural awe. Running against Perry, one of them told Texas Monthly, is like running against God.

title: Housekeepers Lawyer Says He Will Seek a Special Prosecutor
description: The lawyer for the woman who accused Dominique Strauss-Kahn of sexual assault said on Sunday that he would formally ask the judge overseeing the criminal case to disqualify the Manhattan district attorneys office from the prosecution and appoint a special prosecutor.

title: Lottery Numbers
Did Newark Bet on the Wrong Sport?
description: NEWARK  When the first pitch was thrown, there wasnt much of a crowd in the ballpark to see it. Entire sections were unoccupied. The flow of people through the front gate was a trickle. The most fan-generated noise came from a childrens birthday party on a concourse in the right-field corner.

title: Homeowners Need Help
description: Neither Congress, nor federal regulators, nor state or federal prosecutors have yet to conduct a thorough investigation into the mortgage bubble and financial bust. We welcomed the news that the Justice Department is investigating allegations that Standard & Poors purposely overrated toxic mortgage securities in the years before the bust. We hope the investigative circle will widen.

title: Surveillance and Coordination With NATO Aided Rebels
description: WASHINGTON  As rebel forces in Libya converged on Tripoli on Sunday, American and NATO officials cited an intensification of American aerial surveillance in and around the capital city as a major factor in helping to tilt the balance after months of steady erosion of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis military.

title: With the World Series Champs in a Slump, a City Suffers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It is the classic rags-to-riches cautionary tale: a boy from the wrong side of the tracks moves to a new city to make it big. After years of struggle, he gets his break: a string of hits, a hot streak and all the perks that follow, including fame, adoring fans and a television show. But, of course, it comes with a price: self-doubt, questionable decisions and the relentless, almost irrational fear of being a flash in the pan.

title: N.F.L. Crosses a Boundary in the Pryor Case
description: Terrelle Pryor is expected to become a member of the N.F.L. fraternity Monday when the league holds its supplemental draft.

title: More Excuses and Delays From the V.A.
description: It has been more than three months since a panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit accused the Department of Veterans Affairs of unchecked incompetence and unconscionable delays in caring for veterans with mental health problems. Instead of working with the plaintiffs to address the courts concerns, the V.A. is appealing the ruling.

title: Going South
description: Even after the brutal battles at Bull Run and Wilsons Creek had made clear the depth of the conflict awaiting North and South, the people and communities along the border were still trying to decide where their true allegiances lay. Many of them  in Delaware, Maryland, Kentucky and Missouri  tried to find a middle, neutral ground.

title: Tar Sands and the Carbon Numbers
description: This page opposes the building of a 1,700-mile pipeline called the Keystone XL, which would carry diluted bitumen  an acidic crude oil  from Canadas Alberta tar sands to the Texas Gulf Coast. We have two main concerns: the risk of oil spills along the pipeline, which would traverse highly sensitive terrain, and the fact that the extraction of petroleum from the tar sands creates far more greenhouse emissions than conventional production does.

title: Daylight in Yonkers
description: Not all crumbling infrastructure is bad. In Yonkers, on a narrow strip of land sloping up from the Hudson River, lie the gouged-out remains of a downtown plaza and parking lot. It is one of the most encouraging examples of urban destruction the region has seen in years.

title: A Final Surge to Tripoli
description: Rebels took key towns outside Tripoli and then quickly overran the capital.

title: Burress Scores for the Jets in His First Game Since 08
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  On the Jets opening offensive play Sunday, wide receiver Plaxico Burress was the first player to break the huddle and head toward the line of scrimmage. Burresss hurry was understandable: It had been 33 months since his last appearance in an N.F.L. game, and he seemed determined not to wait any longer than absolutely necessary.

title: China and U.S. Choose Safe Site for Biden Visit
description: DUJIANGYAN, China  The choice of sites for visits by foreign leaders is always the product of careful deliberations, but those calculations were particularly evident on Sunday when Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. stopped at a school here.

title: U.S. Open Favorites Can Hear Footsteps
description: MASON, Ohio

title: Eager for Spotlight, but Not if It Is on a Testing Scandal
description: WASHINGTON  Why wont Michelle Rhee talk to USA Today?

title: Egypt and Israel Move to Halt Growth of Crisis
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian and Israeli governments moved Sunday to ease tensions over fatal cross-border attacks, apparently seeking to stop the crisis from flaring up into a full-scale diplomatic rift.

title: After Bruising Political Fights, 2 Governors Alter Their Tones
description: SAYNER, Wis.  After Gov. Scott Walker, a Republican in his first months in office, announced early this year that he wanted to cut collective bargaining rights for public workers, relations between political parties in his newly red State Capitol fell into a long, deep frost.

title: In the Race to Succeed Weiner, a Surprising Anger at Obama
description: Of all the places to hear fulminations against President Obama, one of the least expected is the corner of 71st Avenue and Queens Boulevard, in the heart of a Congressional district that propelled Democrats like Geraldine A. Ferraro, Charles E. Schumer and Anthony D. Weiner to Washington.

title: For Tigers, Cabrera Is Complete Package, Handled With Care
description: DETROIT  The call came to Dave Dombrowskis home around Thanksgiving in 2007, and he knew that was unusual. Dombrowski, the president and general manager of the Detroit Tigers, does not usually hear from his boss at home.

title: Burress Ends His Wait on the Very First Play
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  On the Jets opening offensive play Sunday, wide receiver Plaxico Burress was the first player to break the huddle and head toward the line of scrimmage. Burresss hurry was understandable; it had been nearly 33 months since his last appearance in an N.F.L. game, and he seemed determined not to wait any longer than absolutely necessary.

title: Neighbor Stadiums
description: Bears and Eagles Riverfront Stadium in Newark and Red Bull Arena in Harrison, N.J., are not far apart, but the sizes of their crowds  and perhaps their futures  are very different.

title: Leaders of the Libyan Rebellion
description: The Libyan rebels fighting to topple Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi are led by longtime opponents of the government and officials who defected once the rebellion began.

title: Large Zone Near Japanese Reactors to Be Off Limits
description: TOKYO  Broad areas around the stricken Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant could soon be declared uninhabitable, perhaps for decades, after a government survey found radioactive contamination that far exceeded safe levels, several major media outlets said Monday.

title: Rebels Close In on Tripoli
description: As rebels crept to within 10 miles of the Libyan capital, they vowed to combine forces with insurgents who have waged intense battles inside Tripoli.

title: Pryors Presence Adds a Dash of Spice to the Normally Sleepy Supplemental Draft
description: The N.F.L.s supplemental draft is typically such a non-event that even some of the leagues general managers barely acknowledge it.

title: A Ministry of Health
description: Mississippi is at the bottom of most health-related lists, and the Mississippi Delta is at the bottom of that bottom. But a church-based initiative is looking to improve the situation.

title: Preaching a Healthy Diet in the Deep-Fried Delta
description: HERNANDO, Miss.  Not much seems out of place in the Mississippi Delta, where everything appears to be as it always has been, only more so as the years go by. But here in the fellowship hall of a little Baptist church on a country road is an astonishing sight: a plate of fresh fruit.

title: Cycling Stars Journey to Colorado to Test the Air
description: As Australias newly minted Tour de France champion, Cadel Evans, sees it, this weeks inaugural running of the USA Pro Cycling Challenge is something of a high-altitude science project on wheels. Evanss familiar rivals from Luxembourg, the brothers Andy and Frank Schleck  who finished second and third in France  seem to agree: its all about the rarefied air.

title: Instead of a Bloody Struggle, a Headlong Rush Into a Cheering Capital
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  In the end, it was more of a Sunday drive than a punishing final offensive.

title: Couples Wins, Beating Wind and a Sore Hip
description: HARRISON, N.Y.  Fred Couples never looked right Sunday.

title: A Reluctant Sports Star Discreetly Takes His Leave
description: When Chris Drury announced his retirement from the N.H.L. on Friday, of course it was in the most low-profile way possible. There were no news conferences, no television appearances, no teary-eyed remembrances of a 12-year career. He had the players union release a statement and that was it. It did not even contain a quotation from Drury.

title: For Georgetown, a Peaceful Win in China
description: SHANGHAI  Three days after an ugly brawl ended an exhibition basketball game between Georgetown and a Chinese professional team, the Hoyas played another game here on Sunday without incident.

title: Jimmy Sangster, Writer for British Horror Films, Dies at 83
description: Jimmy Sangster, a prolific screenwriter best known for his classic 1950s horror movies that dipped into the cinematic delights of gore and sex and helped define the British company Hammer Films, died on Friday. He was 83.

title: Window Falls Remain a Childhood Hazard
description: Nearly 100,000 children, most of them under the age of 5, have been injured after falling from a window during the past two decades in the United States, new research shows.

title: Sports Replay: Aug. 21
description: The day in sports, including baseball, surfing, and the San Francisco Triathlon at Alcatraz.

title: Strauss-Kahn Case Is Said to Be Set for Dismissal
description: Three months after authorizing Dominique Strauss-Kahns swift indictment after his arrest on sexual assault charges, the Manhattan district attorney, Cyrus R. Vance Jr., has decided to ask a judge to dismiss the case, a person briefed on the matter said on Sunday.

title: Nunez Impresses With Bat, if Not His Glove
description: Eduardo Nunez of the Yankees has had big shoes to fill this season. He started at shortstop while Derek Jeter was on the disabled list in June and started the bulk of the games at third base after Alex Rodriguez had knee surgery in July.

description: Libyan rebels marched into the capital with relative ease.

title: Comfort Zones

title: Qaddafis Son Taunts Rebels in Tripoli
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  The euphoria that followed the rebels triumphant march in Tripoli gave way to confusion and wariness on Monday, as Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi remained at large, his son Seif al-Islam made a surprise appearance at a hotel with foreign journalists, and pockets of loyalist forces stubbornly resisted rebel efforts to take control of the capital.

title: Stocks Barely Rise After Long Losing Streak
description: Coming off four straight weeks of brutal losses, stocks ended barely higher on Monday, as investors attention turned to the Federal Reserves annual symposium later this week in Jackson Hole, Wyo.

description: Test your math skills with todays question, created by Bobson Wong at Math for America from the article At Stores, Making 5 for $5 a Bigger Draw Than 1 for $1.

title: North Korea to Auction Resort Owned by South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea on Monday gave South Korean tourism officials 72 hours to leave a mountain resort, saying it would start auctioning off South Korean-owned hotels, restaurants and other remnants of what used to be a symbol of inter-Korean cooperation.

title: News Quiz | Aug. 22, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Aug. 22, 1902 | Theodore Roosevelt Becomes First President to Ride in an Automobile
description: On Aug. 22, 1902, President Theodore Roosevelt kicked off a tour of New England with a car ride through Connecticut. His journey marked the first time a United States president made a public appearance by automobile while in office.

title: In Ireland, Ghosts of Towns That Never Were
description: Property Listing: Three bedrooms! Two baths! Half an acre! Living room, with fireplace. Close to schools and parks. Absolutely no neighbors!

title: Malaysian Opposition Leader Begins Defense
description: KUALA LUMPUR  The Malaysian opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim began his defense in his sodomy trial on Monday, declaring the charges a vile and despicable attempt at character assassination.

title: Eli Mannings Interceptions, One by One
description: On Sunday, Jorge Castillo of The Times wrote of Eli Manning:

title: Plaxico Burresss Impressive Return, in His Words
description: A lot of people have shared their opinions about how well Plaxico Burress will do (or wont do) in his first season since being released from jail. Burress spoke with his play in his preseason debut on Sunday night with the Jets, with a catch on the teams opening offensive play and a diving touchdown catch before halftime. The message to the rest of the league seemed to be: Dont dare cover me one-one-one. Oh, and Im back.

title: A Sales Tax on Wall Street Transactions
description: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts Amherst.

title: In Madrid, Exploring Galicia Through Photography
description: A disinterested priest takes confession from an elderly woman. A young girl walks in a Catholic procession with large votive candles clutched in her tiny hands. A woman lies in a coffin and cools herself with a fan. Each of these memorable scenes appear in Transtempo, an exhibition of Cristina Garca Roderos photography on view through Oct. 2 at the Crculo de Bellas Artes de Madrid (Calle Alcal, 42; 34-91-360-5400; www.circulobellasartes.com).

title: Americans Abroad: Goals Galore, Transfers and More
description: The soccer transfer window in Europe slams shut on Aug. 31, which means its a nervous time for players stuck in unfavorable situations.

title: Another 15 Minutes of Fame for an iPad Case
description: Andy Warhol said that In the future, everyone will be world famous for 15 minutes. With its second line of iPhone, iPad and MacBook covers featuring Warhol artwork, the manufacturer Incase is apparently going for a half hour.

title: Aug. 22 Updates on the Battle for Libya
description: The Lede is following the battle for the Libyan capital, Tripoli, on Monday as rebel forces seek to push Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi from power after nearly 42 years. Read earlier updates from Saturday and Sundays fighting.

title: Libyan Rebels Arrive in Tripoli
description: WHO has marched into Tripoli?WHO is the leader of Libya?

title: What Would You Do if You Were President?
description: For an Op-Ed piece, 12 Americans who dont work in politics or the media were asked what they would do if they were president. What would you do? What issues do you think are most pressing?

description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners this week.

description: As our city planners attempt to convert more automotive thoroughfares into usable outdoor space for pedestrians, they might consider throwing a bone to cars by eliminating the six-month traveling commercial circus known as the street fair.

title: Rick Perrys Scientific Campaign Method
description: Sasha Issenberg, a former Boston Globe reporter who has also written for Monocle, Slate, Philadelphia and The New York Times Magazine, has been writing a book about the new science of campaigns called The Victory Lab. Its scheduled for publication next year.

title: What Drives Cities Runaway Growth?
description: Urban areas are growing even faster than urban populations are, and by 2030 urbanized land around the globe will expand by 590,000 square miles  an amount almost equal to the land mass of Mongolia, according to a new study.

title: 2011 Chicago Bears Season Preview
description: Andy Benoit is previewing all 32 N.F.L. teams. He kicks off the N.F.C. North with an analysis of the Bears, who will be playing the Giants tonight in a preseason game.

title: Mass Graves Hold Thousands, Kashmir Inquiry Finds
description: NEW DELHI  Thousands of bullet-riddled bodies are buried in dozens of unmarked graves across Kashmir, a state human rights commission inquiry has concluded, many of them likely to be those of civilians who disappeared more than a decade ago in a brutal insurgency.

title: New Fighting Tempers Rebel Euphoria From Headlong Rush Into Capital
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  Fresh fighting erupted in the Libyan capital on Monday, as members of a rebel brigade trying to establish a security base near the waterfront came under fire from loyalists to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi. Reporters accompanying the rebel brigade were forced to duck for cover.

title: Monday Reading: Another Look at the 15-Year Mortgage
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: The Ritual Draping of Politics on Sept. 11
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg says that politics must be kept out of the ceremony that will be held on the 10th anniversary of the Sept. 11 attacks. This understandable sentiment is being been sorely tested by New Jerseys governor, Chris Christie, who has a habit of treating public discourse as if it were roller derby by other means.

title: Gyrating Markets Are What You Signed Up For
description: During the last few weeks, Ive heard a lot of chatter about volatility. I knew something was going on when I overheard people at the grocery store talking about their investments, saying things like,This volatility is killing me.

title: A Good Phone With One Bad Feature
description: The myTouch 4G Slide is a well designed phone offering a spacious keyboard, a terrific camera, a fast processor and one of the most infuriating features I have ever encountered  a Wi-Fi calling app that charges you voice minutes.

title: Theres Room for More G.O.P. Candidates
description: Rather than douse speculation about which additional Republicans might enter the presidential sweepstakes, Rick Perrys announcement that he would seek the White House seemed only to stoke the fire. At least five prominent Republicans  Sarah Palin, Representative Paul Ryan, Gov. Chris Christie, Rudolph W. Giuliani and George Pataki  are being linked to potential bids.

title: The S.E.C.s Document Destruction Problem
description: The revelation that the Securities and Exchange Commission had a history of destroying documents has once again raised questions about how well the agency has exercised its enforcement authority.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Star Analysts Are Back (No Autographs, Please) | Its official: Internet analysts, the research stars of the dot-com era, are hot again.

description: The video is directed by Michael Schur, a co-creator of NBC's "Parks and Recreation." It is based on a section of "Infinite Jest" by David Foster Wallace.

title: 20 Years Later, Schumacher Returns to Spa
description: The Formula One world is beginning to wake up from its summer break, and the teams are sending out their press release previews as they prepare to step back into the fray for the final half of the season. The Mercedes team highlighted the phenomenal moment the coming Belgian Grand Prix at Spa Francorchamps represents for one of its drivers.

title: 20 Years Later, Schumacher Returns to Spa
description: The Formula One world is beginning to wake up from its summer break, and the teams are sending out their press release previews as they prepare to step back into the fray for the final half of the season. The Mercedes team highlighted the phenomenal moment the coming Belgian Grand Prix at Spa Francorchamps represents for one of its drivers.

title: The City Stirs | Brooklyn, 5:21 A.M.
description: Lost, yesterday, somewhere between sunrise and sunset, two golden hours, each set with sixty diamond minutes. No reward is offered for they are gone forever.   Horace Mann

title: Infinite Jest Scene, Reborn as a Rock Video
description: LOS ANGELES  While there are many details in the life of Michael Schur, the co-creator and show runner of the NBC comedy Parks and Recreation, that convey his obsession with the David Foster Wallace novel Infinite Jest, perhaps the most salient is that his wife once forbade him from discussing that 1,079-page-long work of fiction at social gatherings. If you were at a cocktail party and you go, Oh, youre a person whos into this? Mr. Schur said recently at his office in Studio City, now I know what you and I are doing for the next two hours. Were talking about this.

title: Has Globalization Ruined Street Style?
description: Ts fall reports on mayhem and street fashion  from London, Cairo and Tokyo  beg a question: how has globalization affected street style? The opinion departments Room for Debate blog asked five experts to weigh in.

title: TimesCast | Obama's Stakes in Libya
description: The seeming collapse of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi's regime represents good news for President Obama after months of criticism for his Libya policy.

title: Ghost Musical to Materialize on Broadway in the Spring
description: There was no immediate warning about whether audience members in the first five rows might be spattered with stray bits of clay, but on Monday the producers of the musical version of Ghost, the supernatural romance that showed us how the living and the dead could collaborate around a pottery wheel, said it will come to Broadway in the spring.

title: Al Jazeera Star Correspondent Rejoins NBC
description: Ayman Mohyeldin, a star Al Jazeera English correspondent, is rejoining NBC News, the news organization where he started 10 years ago.

title: Shootings Draw Attention to Stadium Violence
description: If you look at professional sports personnel rosters, you will increasingly find someone called a Fan Ambassador or Fan Experience Manager. This person presumably works to make attending games more enjoyable and persuade people to sign over their entire bank account to the team instead of just 90 percent. In light of the weekends developments, however, its hard to imagine that more T-shirt giveaways or a punt, pass and kick contest will make people less uptight about heading to a stadium these days.

title: Numberplay: Dont Make a Triangle, Part 2
description: Katherine Cook of the Math for Love team continues this week with the second in our two-part triangle series. After the puzzle youll find Ms. Cooks essay on the importance of making mistakes in mathematics. Mistakes! Ms. Cook has good things to say about them. Weve seen this in the best Numberplay discussions  the most productive inquiries come from what turn out to be initial mis-steps. So lets go for an abundance of mistakes this week.

title: Cerberus Kills $1.1 Billion Deal With Innkeepers
description: 5:58 p.m. | Updated

title: The Temporary Vegetarian: Tomato, Oregano and Feta Risotto
description: The Temporary Vegetarian is retiring as of this column, only to be reborn as a book, renamed The Occasional Vegetarian, to be published by Hyperion ($18.99) in October.

title: Volkswagen Up, a 3-Cylinder City Car, Is Heading to Production
description: In advance of its formal introduction next month at the Frankfurt auto show, the Up, an exercise in fuel efficiency and miniaturization, was unveiled online by Volkswagen over the weekend. The vehicle goes on sale in Europe in December, a holiday gift for the city-car set.

title: Plant Exploration in Humid Tropical Forests
description: Paola Pedraza, assistant curator of the Institute of Systematic Botany at the New York Botanical Garden, writes about her recent expedition to catalog the flora of Las Orqudeas National Park, Colombia.

title: The Happiest States of America: North Dakota on the Rise
description: North Dakota is not only the most employment-rich state in the country. Its also on its way to becoming the happiest.

title: Does Roger Maris Belong in the Hall?
description: Fans of Roger Maris were quick to respond to my column Sunday, in which I wrote that his 61 home runs looked better than ever after a half century.

title: Creating a Community
description: A group of seniors came together to build a community for their old age.

title: Vitamins May Lower Risk of Preterm Births
description: Taking a multivitamin around the time of conception may help women lower their risk of delivering low-birth-weight babies, new research shows. The study, one of the first to look at multivitamin use immediately before and after conception, strengthens the notion that nutritional deficiencies may increase the risk of birth complications.

title: A Pharaoh Lords Over a Museum
description: A giant 4,000-year-old Egyptian visitor looms over the crowd of live humans milling antlike throughout the vast entry hall of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. He is an extraordinary specimen of regal manhood. Carved from a single block of dark gray granodiorite, he sits in a form-fitting kilt on a cubic throne covered by hieroglyphics. He has the broad shoulders, narrow waist and muscular legs of a well-developed athlete. Sporting a headdress of folded striped fabric, he gazes out over the masses with imperturbable self-assurance and open eyes set in a round, youthful face. He is as thrilling as anything in the Mets great Egyptian collection.

title: New York Fringe Festival Report: Winner Take All (A Rock Opera)
description: Reviews of shows from the New York International Fringe Festival will appear on ArtsBeat from now to the festivals close on Aug. 28. For more information, go to fringenyc.org.There isnt much at the center of Winner Take All (A Rock Opera), at the Bleecker Street Theater, but theres a lot surrounding it, all delightful. Basically, Ricky (Jared Zirilli), a singer-musician, argues with his girlfriend, Catie (Anna Ellinsfeld), dies on his motorcycle and goes to heaven. There he is recruited by angels (Jacquelyn Graham, Darren Lorenzo and Kyle Lamar Mitchell) to confront the Devil (Brian Charles Rooney) and his minions (Kat Nejat and Zakiya Young) in a face-off with the future of music and all creation at stake. Catie is roped in; she can sing too, you see, and someone has to restore Rickys life.

title: New Names in the Dior Hat
description: I am not at all surprised that LVMH executives are talking to Marc Jacobs about moving from Louis Vuitton to Dior, as Womens Wear Daily reported on Monday. Not to disparage Mr. Jacobss talents, but where else can they look? With few exceptions, the strategy of Bernard Arnault, the chairman of LVMH, has been to load up his brands with big, bankable stars, and there are not many of them available. Shortly after John Galliano was dismissed from Dior, editors put together an imaginary list of candidates: Alber Elbaz of Lanvin, Tom Ford, Nicolas Ghesquiere of Balenciaga, among others. Yet for obvious reasons these individuals might be happy where they are, as would Sarah Burton, the creative director of Alexander McQueen, whose name surfaced soon after the royal wedding in April. According to WWD, she rebuffed overtures from LVMH.

title: New York Fringe Festival Report: Chasing Heaven
description: Reviews of shows from the New York International Fringe Festival will appear on ArtsBeat from now to the festivals close on Aug. 28. For more information, go to fringenyc.org.Youd think Leah Maddrie had a crystal ball. The same week that Stephen Sondheims letter to The New York Times about Diane Pauluss forthcoming revisionist production of Porgy and Bess became the talk of the town, Ms. Maddries Chasing Heaven began its run at the New York International Fringe Festival.

title: Low Wages in Texas
description: I guess Ross Douthats column requires some sort of reply. So let me address three issues.

title: Weighing Race and Hate in a Mississippi Killing
description: JACKSON, Miss.  No one disputes that James Craig Anderson, a middle-aged black family man with a quick wit and a demanding sense of style, was robbed, beaten and then run over by a group of white teenagers in a motel parking lot early one morning in June.

title: Qaddafis Whereabouts Still a Mystery as Rumors Swirl

title: Save the Statistical Abstract
description: I dont usually find myself in hearty agreement with Robert Samuelson, but hes right about this. The Statistical Abstract is a hugely important resource; experts in a particular field may not need it, but its invaluable to non-experts in need of basic information.

title: Ford and Toyota to Work Together on Hybrid System for Trucks
description: DEARBORN, Mich.  Ford Motor Company and Toyota Motor said on Monday that they would jointly develop a gas-electric hybrid fuel system for pickup trucks and sport utility vehicles aimed at keeping larger models affordable as the automakers work to meet stricter fuel-economy standards.

description: ArtsBeat is taking a look at some of the most clever, mysterious and strikingly designed postcards created to draw attention among the nearly 200 productions in this years New York International Fringe Festival.

title: A Fundamental Republican Science Problem
description: Many efforts to gauge why most Republicans reject or doubt the science pointing to risks from unabated emissions of greenhouse gases are issue-centric. Its fossil fuel money. Its disinformation campaigns that spin scientific complexity and some overheated warming rhetoric into a carbon-tax conspiracy.

title: Under Bloomberg, a Sharp Rise in Accusations of Cheating by Educators
description: Annual allegations of test-tampering and grade-changing by educators have more than tripled since Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg took control of New York Citys school system, outpacing a broader increase in complaints of adult misconduct in schools during the same period, according to the special commissioner of investigation.

title: Governing in the Gap
description: Recently I had a chance to meet the great Israeli writer David Grossman at a writers conference in Sun Valley, Idaho (life is good). description: No. 5 in a series of original artworks.

title: 34 Years Later, Supreme Court Will Revisit Eyewitness IDs

description: All parenting milestones mark both beginnings and ends. First steps, and smiles, and days of school all bring our children closer to something  but also further away from us.

description: The father of Amy Winehouse, the British soul singer who died last month, said he has had to return donations to people who supported his plan to set up a foundation in his daughters name because someone else had claimed The Amy Winehouse Foundation as an Internet domain name, The Guardian reported Monday.

title: Student Journalism | A Guide to Rights and Responsibilities
description: Perhaps youre a veteran school newspaper adviser, or maybe youre a new teacher who has just been handed the school paper as part of your program. Or you may find yourself as part of an effort to start or relaunch a school newspaper or journalism course. Or maybe youre looking to refresh your curriculum  or integrate the Common Core Standards  in new ways this school year in your English, humanities, social studies or other courses.

title: What Were Reading
description: A collection of links by the reporters and editors of the Dining section.

title: Death Toll Passes 600 From Raid in South Sudan
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  The death toll from a cattle raid in an eastern region of weeks-old South Sudan rose significantly on Monday with the United Nations saying more than 600 people had been killed in what was a retaliatory attack that has raised fears of ethnic instability on the deeply impoverished country.

title: The Scramble for Access to Libyas Oil Wealth Begins
description: HOUSTON  The fighting is not yet over in Tripoli, but the scramble to secure access to Libyas oil wealth has already begun.

description: OTTAWA  Canadas political opposition was significantly weakened after the death Monday of the countrys New Democratic Party leader, Jack Layton.

title: Dollar Store Drive By
description: Here in the photo department, we love our serendipity. A few months ago, we called the photographer Tim Davis to ask him if he was willing to photograph dollar stores for Jacks Hitts article, The Dollar Store Economy. Not only was Davis willing, he told us, but he was already involved in shooting dollar stores. In fact, he had just wrapped a wonderful video called Dollar Store Drive By.

description: As he still remains at large, John F. Burns reports on the various places Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi could currently be hiding.

description: Mitt Romney has never claimed to be a middle-class man of the people.

title: Parallels Between Qaddafi and Hussein Raise Anxiety for Western Leaders
description: LONDON  Nearly 20 years ago, on the eve of the Persian Gulf war, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi protested when a visiting reporter compared him to Saddam Hussein, rejecting the suggestion that Mr. Husseins invasion of Kuwait had caused him to supplant Colonel Qaddafi as the Wests principal nemesis in the Arab world.

title: A Neighborhood Bar Where They Bend Elbows Over and Over
description: Lionel Mendoza, 54, a truck driver from the Bronx, flaunted his bodybuilders physique on Saturday and said, You could say this body was literally built by the streets of New York City.

title: Retirement Plans Dont Have to Give You a Cash Option
description: The recent wild swings of the stock market had a lot of investors seeking the safety of cash, at least temporarily. One Bucks reader wrote to lament that the retirement plan offered by his former employer, a large not-for-profit institution, lacked what he deemed suitable options for putting investments in cash.

title: Flamingos, Up Close and Personal
description: WASHINGTON  Stranded alone in Germany over a sullen white Christmas several years back, Nira Pereg, a video artist from Tel Aviv, decided to seek distraction at the Karlsruhe zoo.

title: Even Preseason Football Lifts TV Ratings
description: They may have only one playoff victory since the 1997 season, but the Dallas Cowboys still bill themselves as Americas Team  and they have the ratings to match. The Cowboys preseason game against San Diego on NBC averaged 9.6 million total viewers over the course of prime time on Sunday, handily winning the night in overall viewers and in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic among the broadcast networks. (The Chargers won, 20-7.) CBS came in second for the night with a new episode of Big Brother (8.8 million viewers).

title: Dissent in Syria Emerges as Front Line of Arab Uprisings
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  On the night that Libyan rebels poured into the citadel of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, inaugurating Libyas future, his counterpart in Syria offered assurances borrowed from the past: Syria would stay steadfast, plots hatched from abroad would fail and calls for his removal were meaningless because the people supported him.

title: Monday Motorsports: Kyle Busch Secures Position in Sprint Cup Chase
description: At last Mondays rescheduled Sprint Cup race at Watkins Glen, Kyle Busch jockeyed in the final laps with Marcos Ambrose before a caution flag came out, robbing Busch of momentum and enabling Ambroses final charge to victory. On Sunday at Michigan International Speedway, as the final laps were run, Busch could not be caught.

title: On Food Safety, a Long List but Little Money
description: This summer there has been a drumbeat of food-related illnesses. Strawberries containing E. coli killed one person in Oregon and sickened at least nine others. Ground turkey contaminated with salmonella poisoned more than 100 people nationwide, with one dead, and prompted one of the largest meat recalls ever. Imported papayas tainted with salmonella sickened at least 99. Sprouts grown in Idaho were linked to salmonella illnesses in five states.

title: E-Book Author Signs Print Deal With Simon & Schuster
description: John Locke, the first self-published author to sell one million e-books on Amazon.com, has made a deal with Simon & Schuster for the sales and distribution of his print books. Mr. Locke said he wanted to allow readers traditional access to his books, which include the Donovan Creed thrillers and several westerns. Simon & Schuster, which called it a win-win for all concerned, said it would begin to print and distribute Mr. Lockes books in February, making them available in bookstores and through online retailers.

title: Shared Meals, and Lives
description: Faced with the usual options for senior housing and elder care, some older adults are inventing their own grassroots versions  do-it-yourself senior living thats friendlier, more autonomous and less expensive. Fellows in the News21 program at the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism are posting video reports on four of these: a shared housing arrangement in White Plains, a senior cohousing development in Virginia, an urban village in Chicago and an R.V. community in East Texas.

title: Rebels Sudden Success Sends European Backers Scrambling
description: PARIS  The apparent collapse of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis security forces is at least a partial victory for President Nicolas Sarkozy of France and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, who pushed the Security Council and then the NATO alliance into vital military support for the rebels.

title: Prosecutor Asks Court to Drop Charges Against Strauss-Kahn
description: Updated, 4:48 p.m. | Prosecutors in the office of Cyrus R. Vance Jr., the Manhattan district attorney, have filed papers requesting that all charges be dropped against Dominique Strauss-Kahn, the former head of the International Monetary Fund.

title: Peanut Problems
description: Q. When I observe student teachers in a school auto shop, there is almost always an engine retrofitted to run on biofuels like used peanut oil. Is it safe for students with a severe peanut allergy to be around it or work on it?

title: News From Libya Pushes G.O.P. Candidates to Respond
description: During remarks in New Hampshire last month, Mitt Romney accused President Obama of mission muddle for expanding United States operations in Libya beyond enforcing a no-fly zone to a wider goal of preventing Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi from attacking his own people.

title: Reviewing John Brown Smokehouse and Mables Smokehouse
description: Reviewing John Brown Smokehouse and Mables Smokehouse

title: Members of Merkel's Party Emphasize Opposition to Euro Bonds
description: FRANKFURT  Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany has faced harsh criticism for being too passive in the face of Europes debt crisis. But on Monday, members of her own party and the Bundesbank made it clear just how hard it would be for her to pursue any solution that asked German taxpayers to sacrifice for the sake of European unity.

title: Saying Goodbye to a New College Student
description: Earlier today, Pam Allyn walked us through the literal and metaphorical inventory you take before sending a child off to college. Next up, Melissa T. Shultz, who just dropped her son off at the University of Southern California, is writing about that actual moment of goodbye.

title: Ryan Says No to 2012  Again
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin never said he was running for president. In fact, he said again and again that he had no plans to seek the Republican nomination. Yet even with his repeated denials, several conservative leaders had stepped up their efforts in the last week and urged him to reconsider.

title: App Smart Extra: Another Round of Wine Apps
description: Thursdays App Smart column covered the apps that wine lovers should use when they buy a new bottle or dust one off from their wine cellars. But mobile apps can benefit oenophiles in other ways too.

title: A Protein That Bosses Plant Cells Around
description: Plant growth can seem like a busy construction site, with a lot of activity by components called microtubules, structures that capture, store and move around plant material to help grow and shape cells.

title: Doctors Hone Message on Kidney Disease
description: A patient with early-stage kidney disease provided a recent wake-up call for Dr. Joseph Vassalotti, a leading kidney specialist. After explaining the diagnosis in great detail, the doctor asked his patient to repeat what he had heard in his own words.

title: Financial Analysts Coming to a Bookstore Near You
description: Michael Mayo and Richard X. Bove are two of Wall Streets most outspoken stock analysts.

title: Farewell to a Master of Energy, Mobility and Vibes
description: Lee Schipper, who died last week after losing a battle with pancreatic cancer, was an unsung hero in efforts to underpin energy and transportation policies with data and to foster cleaner, smarter transportation systems in fast-growing cities around the world.

title: Reviewing John Brown Smokehouse and Mables Smokehouse
description: New Yorks barbecue options continue to expand, as the citys restaurateurs cut yet more notches in their Barbecue Belt explorations. Two of the citys latest cue joints  John Brown Smokehouse in Long Island City, Queens, and Williamsburgs Mables Smokehouse  bring the smoked meats traditions of Kansas City, Mo., and Oklahoma City, respectively, to New York. Both of them turn out some delicious food.

title: A $19 Million Coat for Blustery Days
description: Wanted: contractor for big paint job on Staten Island. Great views, competitive compensation ($19 million). Must be comfortable working on barges. Bring along 12,000 gallons of paint.

title: Whetherly Tees Are the Tops
description: Having learned a thing or two about thoughtful thread count at Citizens of Humanity, the breakout designer Leila Nasseri put fabric right up there with fit when planning her knits line, Whetherly. If you want to feel good without trying too hard, that means asking yourself, How good does this feel against my skin?, too, Nasseri says. Using lightweight jerseys and the softest supima cottons, then applying silicone and enzyme washes to enhance the way these fabrics take color, Nasseri lets the achieved fluidity and flexibility inform her tees shapes and silhouettes. To keep your Whetherly tee feeling every bit as soft as the day you bought it, Nasseri says: Hand-wash in cold water, air-dry to prevent pilling, and fold, dont hang. Consider it done.

title: John Brown Smokehouse and Mables Smokehouse
description: NOT long ago New York was bereft of true barbecue, save for one outpost called Pearsons in Long Island City, Queens. Since its departure, notable practitioners of the craft were largely absent from the area, until the recent opening of JOHN BROWN SMOKEHOUSE, 25-08 37th Avenue (Crescent Avenue); (718) 361-0085; johnbrownsmokehouse.org.

title: Some Travel Problems in Need of Solutions
description: DENVER

title: Summer Dishes With Grains and Beans
description: Every summer, I take an inventory of the dry goods in my pantry and try to use up at least some of the grains and beans that Ive accumulated over the year. This summer the shelves are particularly well stocked, so expect a few of these clean-out columns over the next couple of weeks.

title: Israeli Self-Defense or Tai Chi? Depends on Whos Watching
description: BUSINESS travel has always been a part of my career. I got the idea for my latest venture, ZocDoc, when I was coming back from Seattle after working on a project when I was with McKinsey & Company. It was a late-night flight and I had a horrible sinus infection. I heard this strange popping noise and then I felt like someone was sticking a spike into my ear.

title: U.S. Says It Wont Bid for Games in 2020
description: The United States Olympic Committee will not submit a bid to host the 2020 Summer Games, meaning the Olympics will not be held in the United States for at least another 11 years.

title: New York Fringe Festival Report: You Only Shoot the Ones You Love
description: Reviews of shows from the New York International Fringe Festival will appear on ArtsBeat from now to the festivals close on Aug. 28. For more information, go to fringenyc.org.

title: Qaddafi at Large as Forces Fight to Control Compound
description: Clashes between Libyan rebels and government troops were reported Monday morning in Tripoli even as residents celebrated the prospective end of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis rule.

title: Circumcise or Dont? Quandary for Parents
description: Before giving birth to her first son three years ago, Allison Manley, now 40, gave a lot of thought to childbirth (she wanted a drug-free delivery), diapers (cloth), vaccines (spaced out) and breast-feeding (absolutely).

title: A Hopeful Future for Libya
description: As the fight for Tripoli continues, the Op-Ed columnist Thomas L. Friedman is hopeful for Libya's future without Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: After Children Leave the Nest
description: Earlier today, Pam Allyn wrote about the literal and figurative inventory you do before a child heads off for school. Later in the day, Melissa T. Shultz wrote about the actual moment of saying goodbye. Next up, Karin Kasdin looks at what happens when the children leave and the parents get back home.

title: Tracking the Movement of Ice Across Antarctica
description: A new map of Antarctica illustrates for the first time how ice moves across the continent. The maps creators believe it may be a crucial tool in helping researchers understand how a warming climate is changing the continent.

title: Helping Out the Family, Especially in Good Times
description: Acorn woodpeckers are industrious, cooperative birds that live in family groups. Each family has several helper woodpeckers that do not breed. These birds devote their time to gathering acorns and other food for the young.

title: Pictures of the Day: Libya and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Libya, Turkey, the West Bank and Pakistan.

title: No Surprise for Bisexual Men: Report Indicates They Exist
description: In an unusual scientific about-face, researchers at Northwestern University have found evidence that at least some men who identify themselves as bisexual are, in fact, sexually aroused by both women and men.

description: THE FACTS

Pictures of the Day: Libya and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Libya, Turkey, the West Bank and Pakistan.

title: Bill Moyers Returns to Public Television, but Not PBS
description: Bill Moyers says he is returning to public television in January, but he wont be found on the PBS lineup.His new hourlong weekly show, called Moyers & Company, will focus on one-on-one interviews with people not often heard on television, thinkers who can help us understand the chaos of this time, Mr. Moyers said in a telephone interview. Were going to be concerned with the state of democracy and the state of affairs, but we will leave the daily and weekly story to others and try to do the back story.

title: 2011 Woodward Dream Cruise slide show
description: 2011 Woodward Dream Cruise slide show

title: Losing a Neighbor, and a Link to a Buildings Past
description: Back around 1943, when Rachael Klausner moved into 200 East 26th Street, an Art Deco rental building of studio and one-bedroom apartments at the corner of Third Avenue, she got to know a woman she later could remember only by her last name, Slotsky.

title: Case Study | The White Peach Sgroppino
description: My sentiments toward the Bellini cocktail, a drink that seems like it should be the apotheosis of fetchingness,are none too generous. If I find myself drinking one, it means, in general, that something has gone terribly wrong: either Ive elected to be hosed down as a tourist in Venice, or somehow Ive blundered my way to brunch at the Olive Garden.

title: Investors Call for 4-Way Breakup of McGraw-Hill
description: 6:32 p.m. | Updated

title: Social Context as Musical Theme
description: ANNANDALE-ON-HUDSON, N.Y.  I believe that pure and purity are dangerous words, best reserved only for food and water, the musicologist Byron Adams said from the stage of the Sosnoff Theater here on Friday night. Mr. Adams, a faculty member at the University of California, Riverside, and a regular at the Bard Music Festival, was delivering a lecture before a chamber music concert titled Nordic Purity, Aryan Fantasies and Music.

title: A Dream Fulfilled, Martin Luther King Memorial Opens
description: WASHINGTON  Now we know: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it leads to a picturesque glade beside the Tidal Basin, with the Washington Monument providing sentry.

title: Joshua Kushners Thrive Capital Raises $40 Million
description: Joshua Kushner, the 26-year-old son of real estate mogul Charles Kushner, has raised $40 million for his venture capital firm, Thrive Capital, according to a regulatory filing on Monday.

title: Fishing Gear Is Altered to Ease Collateral Costs to Marine Life
description: BOSTON  In the world of environmental regulation, where the hope is to write rules that both industry and science can live with, few areas are as contentious as fishing. Especially on the East Coast, fishermen attack scientists as mired in bottomless ignorance about how fish are actually caught. Scientists sometimes describe fishermen as racing to catch the last fish, regardless of the harm to vanishing species.

title: To Circumcise or Not to Circumcise?
description: In todays Science Times, Roni Caryn Rabin writes about a challenge facing a growing number of parents: whether circumcision is the right choice for their sons.

title: A Validation for Bisexual Men
description: A group of researchers at Northwestern University is reporting that men who identify themselves as bisexual are indeed sexually aroused by both women and men. The new report is notable, in part, because the same research group had earlier challenged the very existence of male bisexuality, reporting in 2005 that many men who said they were bisexual had arousal patterns more typical of homosexual men.

title: Lobsters Find Utopia Where Biologists See Trouble
description: For lobstermen working the Gulf of Maine, this is a golden age.

title: A Long Wait Gets Longer
description: As international travel rebounds, the time it takes to get through customs is creeping up at some of Americas busiest airports  especially for passengers who are last off the plane.

title: Judge Again Blocks Work on Landmark New York Office Tower
description: Work on a landmark office tower on Fifth Avenue will remain halted under a judges order filed in a lawsuit challenging renovations to the structure, the former Manufacturers Trust Company building, at 510 Fifth Avenue, at 43rd Street. New York City had filed a motion to dismiss a lawsuit by preservationists who charged that the owner of the building, Vornado Realty Trust, disregarded restrictions intended to protect the interior. But Justice Lucy A. Billings of State Supreme Court in Manhattan denied that motion last week and converted the temporary restraining order she issued last month into a preliminary injunction. It bans Vornado from doing additional work on the site until she considers the merits of the case.

title: Mayor Praises Growth in Film and TV Jobs
description: Once upon a time in New York, the Brooklyn Navy Yard bustled with ships, and an airport called Idlewild was home to a terminal for Pan American World Airways, or Pan Am.

title: A Mothers Long Love Affair With Colonialism
description: Alexandra Fuller recalls in her electrifying new memoir that her mother  Nicola Fuller of Central Africa, as she has on occasion preferred to introduce herself  had always wanted a writer in the family, not only because she loves books and has therefore always wanted to appear in them (the way she likes large, expensive hats, and likes to appear in them) but also because she has always wanted to live a fabulously romantic life, for which she needed a reasonably pliable witness as scribe. When her self-dramatizing mother assessed her life, Ms. Fuller goes on, she matched it up against the kind of biography she hoped to inspire, something along the lines of West With the Night, The Flame Trees of Thika or Out of Africa. On the whole, she was satisfied.

title: Ferrari Testa Rossa Sells for Record $16.4 Million at Pebble Beach
description: MONTEREY, Calif.  An auction record fell here on Saturday, as had been widely expected, with the sale of a 1957 Ferrari Testa Rossa racecar by Gooding & Company at auction. The winning bid was $14.9 million, or about $16.4 million including the buyers premium.

title: For Obama, a Moment to Savor, if Briefly
description: VINEYARD HAVEN, Mass.  President Obama was a reluctant warrior in Libya, drawn into the rebel uprising over the warnings of his Pentagon chief and his own qualms about getting the United States entangled in yet another war in the Muslim world.

title: Letterman Responds to Death Threats in Monologue
description: David Letterman responded on Monday to the threat posted against him last week on a message board used by Al Qaeda in his usual fashion: he made jokes about it.

title: On Woodward Dream Cruise, a Quest for the Wonderful and Wonderfully Odd
description: DETROIT  My family and I were new to the Detroit area in August 1995, when I saw an item in the paper about a nostalgia cruise event scheduled to run along Woodward Avenue, the areas main artery.

title: New Albums From Pistol Annies and Barbra Streisand
description: PISTOL ANNIES

title: Memorials and Reveries in a Cozy Cabaret Setting
description: As the pianist Jerome Kuderna told the story on Sunday evening, Gunther Schuller once called the work of his fellow composer Robert Helps cabaret music for geniuses. It was a compliment that aptly described Mr. Kudernas suave, moody, moving recital at the Cornelia Street Caf.

title: Q&A: Taking Action on Google+
description: Q.

title: Testing Modified Fishing Gear
description: New England Aquarium staff tested experimental fishing gear off Cape Cod in March to see if right whales would avoid luminescent materials.

title: Its Not Every Cabinet Minister Who Can Also Take to the Stage
description: Politicians who promise transparency could learn something from the singer Susana Baca, who is now the Peruvian minister of culture. She is completing an extensive tour planned before her appointment in July. At City Winery on Sunday night, her music was as open as can be: a tidy, lightly propulsive mesh of largely acoustic instruments (the upright bass was electric) that never obscured her gentle but drily resolute voice. And in that show of clarity was a graceful bundle of agendas: memory and modernization, mourning and celebration. Dressed in white, Ms. Baca beamed through her set, sometimes with eyes closed as if she were entranced; now and then she let the rhythms carry her into dance steps.

title: Examining the Mystery of Skeleton, Sugar and Sex
description: THE HYPOTHESIS Bones help regulate fertility in men.

title: Chaffetz Wont Seek Senate Seat in Utah
description: After appearing to spoil for a fight, Representative Jason Chaffetz, Republican of Utah, announced Monday that he would not run for his states Senate seat, removing a potentially formidable rival to Senator Orrin Hatch as Mr. Hatch seeks a seventh term in the Senate.

title: Medical Thriller, With a Life in the Balance
description: I was in a neurologists office to discuss the results of my brain scan. For the past month and a half, Id had headaches that felt as if my skull was underwater, punctuated by frequent electric jolts through the right side of my brain. Two CT scans and an M.R.I. had revealed nothing. All the drug treatments tried by my doctor had failed to change me back into myself.

title: Illegal Downloads of Fox Shows on the Rise
description: August 23 | Updated Adding comment from Fox.

title: A Surge of Sleepiness in China Appears to Have Been Caused by Flu
description: Cases of narcolepsy  a condition that causes sufferers to fall asleep without warning  tripled in China after the 2009 swine flu pandemic, according to a study released Monday. But the surge appeared to be an annual late spring event caused by the flu itself, not by Chinas swine flu vaccination campaign.

title: Tomorrow, Tripoli
description: On Sunday night, the freelance photographer Bryan Denton, on assignment for The New York Times in Libya, entered the heart of Tripoli alongside advancing rebel fighters. For Mr. Denton, who has been covering the war from the perspective of the rebel fighters for six months, the experience felt almost mythical.

title: Qaddafi Leaves Little Behind to Guide Libya in His Absence
description: Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis stranglehold on Libya appears to have ended after 42 years, even if his whereabouts remain elusive. But through countless erratic decrees and iron-handed purges, he has carved deep scars into every facet of Libyan life. The mystery and speculation swirling about him marked a fitting close to a quixotic reign.

title: In Latest Deals, Big Roles for Boutique Investment Banks
description: For merger advisers this year, it has been good to be an independent.

title: Tea Party Favorite Wont Challenge Senate Republican
description: Representative Jason Chaffetz, Republican of Utah, announced Monday that he would not run for the Senate, removing a potentially formidable rival to Senator Orrin Hatch as he seeks a seventh term. Mr. Chaffetz, a Tea Party favorite, had signaled that he was ready to take on Mr. Hatch in the partys nominating process, and he was given a reasonable chance of success after Utah Republicans decided in 2010 to oust Robert F. Bennett, an 18-year veteran of the Senate, in favor of a newcomer, Mike Lee. But Mr. Chaffetz said he would instead seek re-election to the House to focus on a push for fiscal discipline. I can spend the next 15 months doing my job, or I can spend the next 15 months campaigning to do Senator Hatchs, he said in a statement. Despite being tempted to compete for the privilege of serving in the U.S. Senate  and being convinced I could win  I wont allow a fight for that seat to distract me from what I was sent to Washington to do.

title: U.S. Seeking Ways to Finance New Libyan Leaders
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is working to find ways to provide financial assistance to the rebels in Libya, officials said Monday, but the administration intends to maintain a freeze on $37 billion in Libyan assets until it is clear that Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi and his supporters no longer have access to the countrys financial system.

description: In a case with potential implications for the new wave of cloud music services, EMI has won a partial victory against MP3tunes, a company that lets its customers store music files in online lockers.

description: CORAL GABLES, Fla.  When Al Golden left Temple to become the University of Miamis football coach last December, he called his new post a dream job. Now, as the Hurricanes prepare to open the season at Maryland on Sept. 5, that dream has been upended by a convicted con man and the specter of sanctions that will determine the direction of the program and, possibly, its existence.

description: In his 1951 book White Collar, the sociologist C. Wright Mills acknowledged the powerlessness of the white-collar worker while also understanding his importance within a larger context: Yet it is to this white-collar world that one must look for much that is characteristic of twentieth-century existence  They carry, in a most revealing way, many of those psychological themes that characterize our epoch, and, in one way or another, every general theory of the main drift has had to take account of them.

title: All Eyes Fall on the Steward, the Racetracks Final Arbiter
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.  His decisions alter the fortunes of breath-holding bettors, affect the records of quality stakes contenders, and may sully the reputations of veteran and apprentice riders alike.
