description: Barry Bonds will not face a new trial on charges of lying to a federal grand jury about his use of steroids and human growth hormone, according to papers filed Wednesday in federal court.

title: The Debt Non-Explosion
description: A conversation I had earlier today suggested that it might be worth pointing out a fact that isnt as widely known as it should be: namely, that there has not been an explosion in debt over the past few years. There has been a big rise in federal debt, but this has gone along with a collapse in private borrowing, so that overall debt growth has been lower than it was in the pre-crisis years:

title: Traveling Across Libya
description: The Op-Ed Columnist Nicholas D. Kristof finds signs of hope on the road to Tripoli.

title: How AT&T Got to a Standoff With the Government
description: The Justice Departments lawsuit to block AT&Ts $39 billion takeover of T-Mobile USA took the company by surprise. But depending on whom you ask, it shouldnt have.

title: Watching That Home From Afar
description: WERE in the high season for the second home. Everywhere you look, as the Labor Day weekend approaches, someone is packing up for the Hamptons, the Vineyard, Nantucket or Tahoe. Im told that there are unbounded thrills to be had on these sojourns, but Ive never experienced them. Not only do I not own a second home, I dont even own a first.

title: Hip-Hop Finds an Artist to Believe In
description: HIP-HOP has long given shout-outs to alcoholic beverages, foreign cars and jewelry. But recently, an artist has been added to that list.

title: Tough Talk Leads to Difficult Conversations
description: BOSTON  When David Ortiz comes home each night, his 7-year-old son, DAngelo, often asks him questions about what went on during that nights game. Ortiz, the Red Sox designated hitter, enjoys telling DAngelo about a great pitch or a powerful home run, but sometimes  as was the case after Tuesdays game between the Yankees and the Red Sox  Ortiz is forced to answer questions about a scuffle. And he does not like it.

title: George Jensens Liquid Collection
description: A single sheet of stainless steel molded into a seemingly random, asymmetrical form: thats the minimalist look that defines Liquid, a new collection from Georg Jensen.

title: Music for the End of August
19 Have Died of Heat This Summer, City Says
description: The heat wave that gripped the city in late July is turning out to have been a fairly deadly one. Fourteen people are now certified to have died of weather-related hyperthermia, combined with other medical conditions, from July 22 to July 25, the city medical examiners office said Wednesday. Five more died of the heat in August, bringing the total for the summer to 19.

title: Nursing Bras That Show Mothers in More Than Work Mode
description: MATERNITY and nursing bras have long been the ugly stepsisters to gorgeously constructed lingerie. If you became pregnant or nursed your child, scratchy, unadorned, matronly bras  probably colored inconspicuously nude or white  were your lot. Elisabeth Dale, the founder of the Web site The Breast Life, which has bra reviews and health information, says she thinks this was because functionality and sex appeal can seem incompatible.

title: An Airstream Dressed Up for Burning Man
description: A designer and her husband renovated a 1969 trailer to take to the annual festival, creating a Moorish-inspired home for the road.

title: For Burning Man, an Airstream Done Up in Moorish Splendor
description: About 50,000 Burners, as attendees of the annual Burning Man festival are called, were expected to journey to the Black Rock Desert in Nevada this week for days of revelry in a makeshift city where art is everywhere but showers can be hard to come by. The festival, which began on Monday and runs through Monday, sold out in advance for the first time in its 25-year history.

title: A Heros Legend and a Stolen Skull Rustle Up a DNA Drama
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Even with the best scientific techniques, you cant always get what you want. But if you try, as the Rolling Stones put it, sometimes you get what you need.

title: Shopping for Back-to-School Accessories With Jerry Helling
description: The president of Bernhardt Design, a North Carolina furniture company, set out in search of back-to-school accessories worthy of a well-designed desk.

title: Back-to-School Accessories
description: AS president of the North Carolina furniture company Bernhardt Design, Jerry Helling has collaborated with a number of high-profile designers. But in recent years, hes become increasingly invested in working with students.

title: A Glass-Top Desk From Gallotti & Radice
description: Like many of the pieces made by the Italian furniture manufacturer Gallotti & Radice, the Lui desk has a streamlined design that fluidly mixes glass with a variety of other materials.

title: In Maine, Gifts From the Sea, and the Landfill
description: PHIPPSBURG, Me.

title: Since You Cant Stay in Fallingwater ...
description: In 1910, when Frank Lloyd Wright designed the Park Inn and City National Bank building in downtown Mason City, Iowa, he most likely didnt anticipate that one day it would be a boutique hotel. But the restored building recently reopened with 27 rooms, offering architecture enthusiasts the opportunity to spend the night in a Wright building.

title: Youre Not a Stranger When You Leave
description: DANIEL RUF and Patrick Palme, budget-minded students from Hanover, Germany, drove across the United States this spring without paying for nearly any of their accommodations. During the trip, they stayed overnight in 20 cities with people they met through CouchSurfing, a social networking Web site whose members make their homes available to travelers free of charge.

title: Sales at Calypso Home and Others
description: Furniture is 15 percent off and rugs are 20 percent off at Calypso Home, through Monday (a Lima 9-by-12-foot rug, originally $1,900, is $1,520; a silver woven stool, usually $350, is $297); 407 Broome Street (Lafayette Street), (212) 925-6200.

title: Striped Wallpapers From Osborne & Little
description: Theres something innately pleasing about a stripe, noted Peter Osborne, the chief executive and head of design at Osborne & Little, the British wallpaper and fabric company.

title: An Elegantly Frugal Rental in Maine
description: Using found and handmade furnishings, thrift and ingenuity, a talented couple furnished a home stylishly on a budget.

title: Safely Above the New Orleans Parade
description: I AM writing this in an 1832 brick house on Julia Street in New Orleans, a place with all the mildew, mortar dust and karma youd imagine a New Orleans building would have. I write, but dont live, here  if living means more than a MacBook, a tomato sandwich and a passable amount of upkeep for my two rooms and myself. For part of each week, I leave my two daughters and my home in Jackson, Miss., 192 miles away, to coop myself up in a place famous for its live-music venues and restaurants.

title: Homes for $599,000
description: A contemporary outside Charleston, S.C.; a bungalow in Los Angeles; and a house in New Orleans.

title: What You Get for ... $599,000
description: JAMES ISLAND, S.C.

title: In Panama, a Beachfront Retreat
description: A four-bedroom house in the Buenaventura resort is on the market for $1.6 million on Panamas Pacific Coast.

title: House Hunting in ... Panama
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM BEACHFRONT HOUSE WITH A COURTYARD ON PANAMAS PACIFIC COAST

title: Shopping Snapshots: Sept. 1
description: Dolce & Gabbanas newest eyewear collection; Anthropologies wax-finished raincoat; Zac Posen opens Z Spoke boutique in Manhattan; and other items.

title: Speed and Spin: Nadals Lethal Forehand
description: Rafael Nadals forehand is a rare combination of speed and tremendous topspin. Here is a look at how he generates the stroke and how he uses it against his opponents.

title: Look of the Moment | Sarah Jessica Parker
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#15", 592, 500, true, chameleonData);

title: Activists Aim to Revitalize Israeli Protests
description: TEL AVIV  For many Israelis, the size of Saturday nights protests against the high cost of living and for social justice will serve as a barometer of whether the popular movement that began in this Mediterranean city and swept the country this summer is thriving or fading.

title: Vandeweghe Is Stopped in the Second Round
description: Coco Vandeweghe, the promising 19-year-old American who chose tennis over basketball, said she prefers to progress in a consistent rather than streaky manner. After losing in her second-round match against the steadier and more experienced Samantha Stosur, she will have to wait another year to try to reach the third round.

title: Mothers Long Vigil for Seattle Woman Jailed in Murder
description: PERUGIA, Italy  In the sweltering days of summer, the sun-scorched streets of this storied hilltop town echo with the indistinguishable conversations of world travelers here to explore its medieval and Renaissance palazzos or climb its steep alleys to catch a glimpse of the verdant Umbrian countryside.

title: Obama Moves Jobs Speech After Skirmish With Boehner
description: WASHINGTON  Any hopes that a kinder, gentler bipartisan Washington would surface once Congress returns after Labor Day were summarily dashed on Wednesday when President Obama and Speaker John A. Boehner clashed over, of all things, the date and time of the presidents much-awaited speech to the nation about his proposal to increase jobs and fix the economy.
